ItemSource.SourceLine: outBuffer = chrb(0) + chrb(200) ' set extension to use custom
outCustomBuffer = chrb(0) + chrb(203) ' set icon to use
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb((val(EditFieldMHz.text)*10)/256) + chrb(bitwiseand(255,val(EditFieldMHz.text)*10)) ' Descriptive speed in tenths of a MHz
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(0) + chrb(0) ' Never use the short form here
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(3) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(3) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(2) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(3) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(2) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(2) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(1) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(2) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(1) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(1) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(0) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(1) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(0) ' need to understand
outCustomBuffer = outCustomBuffer + chrb(0) ' need to understand
'MsgBox "Error, the Extension doesn't appear to be installed and named as expected?"

Method.ItemParams: target as double, simple as boolean

ItemSource.SourceLine: Function findParameters(target as double, simple as boolean) As boolean
do until halfTarget = (n/(m*pValue))*31.3344 ' could make it possible to adjust this clock in preferences
' save the best result (doubled to represent the CPU clock)
StaticText8.text = str(bestResult) + "MHz with : " + "p=" + str(gPValue) + " m=" + str(gM) + " n=" + str(gN)
Function KeyDown(Key As String) As Boolean
hasSaved = true ' no changes made yet
prevPopup = 6 ' just to suppress the msgbox
elseif currentSetSpeed < 127 then ' non-standard built into extension
prevPopup = 6 ' just to suppress the msgbox
elseif currentSetSpeed = 200 then ' set to custom
prevPopup = 6 ' just to suppress the msgbox
' read speed in from custom (SPDS id 200)
else ' probably another "custom" - not set from here, but handle it anyway
prevPopup = 6 ' just to suppress the msgbox
msgbox "Error reading custom values from SPDS " + str(currentSetSpeed)
MsgBox "Error, the Extension doesn't appear to be installed and named as expected?"

MsgBox "Control Panel for setting the speed of the Soft 475 Overclock. UI and speed change code by Phipli, with the most important overclock code from Mustermann and core extension project by zigzagjoe. 2024 - Version 0.1.1"

msgbox "Warning - This mode is for advanced users only. You Must understand what you are doing. Additionally, on some computers, this type of overclock causes the computer to crash. If your computer is one of these and crashes when the extension loads, switch off the computer with the power switch and power back on holding shift to disable extensions. You can then use this Control Panel to turn the extension off, or switch to 20, 25, 33 or 40MHz."

msgbox "Warning - This mode is for extremely advanced users only. If you do not know how to program the clock chip on your computer, just click cancel in the following dialog box. If the settings you select crash your computer, hold down the shift key during boot and disable the extension, or change to 20, 25, 33 or 40MHz from the main dropdown menu."
if me.text = "Disable Extension" and prevPopup <> 6 then

msgbox "To ensure that your computer is completely back to normal behaviour, you may need to fully shutdown, rather than just restart. A simple restart will return you to your default CPU clock speed."

Sub MouseMove(X As Integer, Y As Integer)
Function KeyDown(Key As String) As Boolean
MsgBox "Error, extension not found or could not be written to."
Sub MouseMove(X As Integer, Y As Integer)
elseif hasSaved = false and pushButton1.Underline = false then

Control.PropertyVal: Use this Popup Menu to select the a target CPU speed.
This is the speed currently written to the Extension, that the computer will switch to during when the extension next loads during startup.
This is the speed that was read from the Extension when the Control Panel was opened.
Custom - This may crash your computer.
Enter the CPU speed you want to use, then click on the 'Calc' button to calculate the required parameters. Click 'Set' to then write these to the extension.
Click this button to write the currently selected speed to the Extension.
Click this button to write the currently selected speed to the Extension.
The calculated parameters for the clock generator are shown here when 'Calc' is clicked.

After entering a target CPU speed, click this button to calculated the parameters required to achieve this speed. The speed wont be exact as there is a level of granularity. After generating the parameters, click 'Set' to write them to the Extension.
The calculated parameters for the clock generator are shown here when 'Calc' is clicked.

ItemSource.SourceLine: currentCustSpd = ((ascb(midb(customString,3,1))*256) + ascb(midb(customString,4,1)))/10 ' number is stored in 1/10ths of MHz

Control.PropertyVal: Warning - Some of the fitted clock generators don't seem to support this functionality. If you get the values wrong or have the unsupported hardware, your computer will crash and you may need to physically power cycle (the hardware power switch).

Control.PropertyVal: The currently selected options haven't been written to the extension. To use these settings, click 'Set'. Otherwise, if you choose to click 'Don't Set', previous settings will be retained.
